New Records: The Rangers claimed their first seven-win homestand in Globe Life Field history.
Key Match Events: Marcus Semien hit a solo home run in the first inning.
Nathaniel Lowe hit a home run in the first inning.
Andrew Heaney pitched six quality innings.
Travis Jankowski contributed with a single in the eighth inning.
David Robertson and Kirby Yates worked scoreless innings in the eighth and ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: Andrew Heaney expressed hope that the team would play loose and free despite being unlikely to make the postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Heaney noted that playing well leads to looseness and continued winning.
Marcus Semien mentioned that scoring runs and hitting home runs helps the team loosen up.
Bruce Bochy acknowledged that this has been the best stretch of baseball for the Rangers this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have won 10 out of their last 13 games, the best stretch in the American League.
The Rangers still trail the Houston Astros by eight games in the AL West and the Minnesota Twins by 6½ games for the final wild card spot.
